intro: Pseudoeriocoma eminens, commonly known as the mountain eriogonum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and stout, erect stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red, which bloom in the spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Pseudoeriocoma eminens is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
